title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Quant (Based on 6th Dec Shift 1) #QA015

questions.text: Find the ratio of scooters sold by A and B together to cars sold by D.
questions.solution: Wait, Q41 in the source file refers to a DI table (Source 1418). The prompt asked to exclude DI. Moving to the next non-DI question. (Checking Q51 onwards for Arithmetic/Series/Simplification).

questions.text: A shopkeeper marked an article 25% above its cost price and allowed 20% profit on the article. If the discount allowed on the article is Rs 20, then find the cost price of the article (in Rs).
questions.solution: Let CP = 100x. MP = 125x. Profit 20% means SP = 120x. Discount = MP - SP = 5x. Given 5x = 20 -> x = 4. CP = 400. [cite: 1521-1522]

questions.text: A and B started a business with investment of Rs 2000 and Rs 4000 respectively. After 6 months B invested 50% more of his initial investment and at the end of the year the total profit of Rs 14000. Find the profit share of B (in Rs).
A 44-liter mixture contains milk and water. The quantity of milk is 6 liters more than that of water. How much water must be added so that the ratio of milk to water becomes equal?
questions.solution: M + W = 44. M - W = 6. Solving gives M = 25, W = 19. To make them equal (M=W), water needed = 25 - 19 = 6 liters. [cite: 1536-1537]

questions.text: 520 meters long train can cross a pole in 13 seconds. Find the time taken by the train to cross 130-meter-long platform (in seconds).
If the circumference of the circle is 88 cm, then find the area of the circle (in cmÂ²).
The present ages of A and B are in the ratio of 7: 9, respectively. Six years ago, the ratio of their ages was 11: 15, respectively. Find the age of B three years from now (in years).
A man spends 20% of his income on rent and 10% of the remaining amount on groceries. He saves the rest. If his total expenditure (on rent and groceries) is Rs 4200, find the amount he saves (in Rs).
questions.solution: Rent = 0.2I. Rem = 0.8I. Groceries = 0.1 * 0.8I = 0.08I. [cite_start]Total Exp = 0.28I = 4200 -> I = 15000. Savings = I - Exp = 15000 - 4200 = 10800. [cite: 1573-1574]

questions.text: The total cost of 6 pens and 9 pencils is Rs 150. What will be three-fourth of the total cost of 12 pens and 18 pencils?
questions.solution: 12 pens + 18 pencils is exactly double the first set. [cite_start]Cost = 2 * 150 = 300. 3/4 of 300 = 225. [cite: 1580-1581]

questions.text: The average of three consecutive even numbers is 106. Find the average of the second largest and the largest numbers.
questions.solution: The numbers are 104, 106, 108. 2nd largest is 106, largest is 108. Average is 107. [cite: 1593-1594]

questions.text: The population of a town increases by 10% in the first year and decreases by 5% in the next. What is the overall percentage change after two years.
Find the wrong number: 220, 225, 215, 231, 206, 242
Find the wrong number: 121, 123, 126, 131, 138, 150
questions.solution: Differences: +2, +3, +5, +7 (Primes). Next should be +11. [cite_start]138 + 11 = 149. 150 is wrong. [cite: 1615]

questions.text: Find the wrong number: 13, 104, 197, 292, 380, 488
questions.solution: Differences: 91, 93, 95... Next should be 97. 292 + 97 = 389. 380 is wrong. [cite: 1622]

questions.text: Find the wrong number: 322, 330, 338, 336, 354, 362
questions.solution: Alternating +8 pattern logic suggests 336 breaks the flow (330+8=338, 338+8=346). [cite_start]336 is wrong. [cite: 1633]

questions.text: Find the wrong number: 3, 4, 7, 10, 18, 34
questions.solution: Pattern: x2 - 2. 4*2 - 2 = 6. The term is 7, which is wrong. [cite: 1639]
